item.title: digikam 2.6.0 wonâ€™t start due to missing libavcodec.so.53 (slackware current64)
item.description: This was pretty simple but complicated :). It turns out I updated alien bob’s repo to ffmpeg 0.11, thus upgrading to libavcodec.so.54. I’m sure I could have gotten away with a simple symlink but I wanted a clean install. So I though I would simply rebuild digikam, right? Wrong. It failed, with weird errors like: make[2]: \*** [extra/libkface/test/detect] Error 1 or collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status make[2]: *** [extra/kipi-plugins/removeredeyes/test/testipp] Error 1 Face detect above sounded a lot like digikam built successfully.
